activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tobias C Wright

records.addlTxt:
8:57 AM Defendant Tobias C Wright in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records Without Extrinsic Evidence, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements, by the State.
of Intent to Introduce Expert Testimony, by the State.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.

2:06 PM Defendant Tobias C Wright appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Tobias C Wright.  Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
